p.s: In the following I'm going to analysing the character of Helen in this Partpart of the novel.
Helen is even smaller than Pearl, but she is only eight years old and Pearl is fourteen years old (l. 1-2).
She never stayed realyreally at one home in her life, she lived here and there near a beach and near a park (l. 7-8).
To say it in a detail way, she lived in 17 different foster homes, because she havehas a collection of telephones with 17 different phones and chargers in her collection of phones (l. 26).
One of every foster home she goes to.
Furthermore Helen havehas ten brothers and eleven sisters (l. 7), so she had a very big family.

In some of her foster homes, she had very bad conditions like She had to reuse dental floss and tea bags and was given one square of toilet paper [...] [or] she slept on the floor in a hallway (l. 15-16).
In Pearl's opinion, Helen smelled like burned marshmallows and she is person who talktalks nonstop (l. 3-5).
Helen also havehas three best friends, who named Lulu, Gina and Romey and she useuses her phone collection to call them.
She is also a person who searchsearches and needs people cuddle with, like in the end of this part of the novel, she rubbed her forehead against [Margot's] upper arm (l. 41-42).
To come to a conclusion Helen is a very cute and happy child, which loveloves to live although she had many ups and down'sdowns in her livelife.
